news.title: Ghaziabad development body to hear out buyers’ complaints once a month
news.para: The Ghaziabad Development Authority has initiated 'Rera Samadhan Diwas' to resolve grievances against it within UP Rera. Held monthly, this initiative aims to address homebuyer complaints directly, preempting the need for regulatory intervention. During the inaugural session, a few complaints were resolved, and assurances led to some complainants withdrawing their cases from UP Rera.

news.title: NIT report in HC suggests retrofitting for LIFE Mission buildings
news.para: NIT Kozhikode's report suggests that the incomplete LIFE Mission housing project in Wadakkancherry can be salvaged with structural interventions, despite poor workmanship and abandonment. Submitted to the Kerala HC, the report addresses a petition seeking project resumption for 140 beneficiary families.

news.title: Greater Bengaluru authority set for September launch
news.para: The historic BBMP head office, home to the city’s administration since 1947, is being upgraded to function as the Chief Minister’s office in his capacity as Chairperson of the new authority. The Bengaluru Urban Development Minister, serving as Deputy Chairperson, will operate from the renovated Deputy Mayor’s office.

news.title: MHA writes to Chandigarh administration again, seeks response on property-related issues
news.para: The Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) has escalated pressure on the Chandigarh administration, issuing a fresh letter to the UT chief secretary demanding responses to long-pending property-related issues. These issues, raised by MP Manish Tewari, include property sales, housing modifications, 'lal dora' abolition, resettlement colony ownership, and group housing society concerns.

news.title: Mumbai: BMC to introduce professional safety licence for officers for high-rise construction sites
news.para: Following Bombay High Court directions, the BMC is urged to introduce professional safety licenses for high-rise projects due to increasing tower crane incidents. The recommendation includes mandating Licensed Safety Officers (LSO) and safety teams for buildings exceeding 120 meters.

news.title: Bengaluru development body invites global tenders to prepare revised master plan-2041
news.para: Bangalore Development Authority has initiated a global tender for the Revised Master Plan 2041, aiming for a data-driven and inclusive framework. This follows the shelving of RMP 2031 due to criticisms. A high-tech 3D drone survey is underway to provide detailed spatial understanding, integrating transit-oriented development to combat congestion and enhance livability, with completion targeted by mid-2026.

news.title: Scrap Janata Vasahat TDR proposal, don’t pause it: Pune activists
news.para: A controversial TDR proposal for slum rehabilitation in Pune's Janata Vasahat is under scrutiny due to alleged land classification irregularities and inflated valuations. Activists and residents are demanding the project's complete cancellation, citing environmental concerns related to development in restricted zones and a lack of transparency in the planning process.

news.title: Objections mount against proposed building rules in Punjab
news.para: Several organizations and activists are strongly opposing the proposed Punjab Unified Building Rules, 2025, fearing they prioritize builders' profits over public well-being. Concerns include unlimited FAR, increased population densities, and weakened fire safety norms, potentially turning cities into concrete jungles.

news.title: From $50 billion to bust, investors count cost of China Evergrande's market tryst
news.para: China Evergrande Group, once a leading developer, has been delisted from the Hong Kong Stock Exchange, marking a significant moment in China's property crisis. Burdened by over $300 billion in liabilities, Evergrande's fall from grace highlights the risks of debt-fueled expansion.

news.title: China's Country Garden forecasts bigger loss after deliveries slump
news.para: Country Garden, grappling with a severe property slump in China, anticipates a larger loss for the first half of 2025 due to halved housing project deliveries and increased asset impairments. The developer, which defaulted on $11 billion in offshore bonds, delivered only 74,000 units compared to over 150,000 last year.

news.title: Centrum Capital to sell its affordable mortgage business to Weaver Services for ₹430 crore
news.para: Centrum Capital has agreed to sell its affordable housing finance arm, Centrum Housing Finance Ltd (CHFL), to Weaver Services for ₹430 crore. CHFL, with assets under management of ₹1,640 crore as of June 30, 2025, serves over 18,000 customers across 100 locations.

news.title: Enforcement directorate files 22 cases in builders-banks nexus case
news.para: Enforcement Directorate has initiated 22 cases. This action investigates the alleged nexus between builders and banks. The focus is on cheating homebuyers in the National Capital Region. These cases stem from CBI FIRs. The FIRs were filed following Supreme Court directives. The investigation aims to uncover fraud and money laundering. It also seeks to recover illicit assets.

news.title: Pune residents want action against officials for permitting constructions on floodlines
news.para: Recent floods near the Mula and Mutha rivers in Pune have reignited concerns over poorly defined red and blue lines, leaving residents worried about their properties. Citizens are demanding accountability from officials for allowing construction in flood-prone areas, highlighting the administrative confusion and lack of coordination between local bodies and the irrigation department.

news.title: Chandigarh admin directs CHB to install firefighting system at Dhanas rehabilitation colony
news.para: Punjab Governor Gulab Chand Kataria has directed the Chandigarh Housing Board to urgently install a firefighting system at the Dhanas Rehabilitation Colony, where over 45,000 residents have been without adequate fire safety for 13 years. Despite mandatory requirements and repeated requests, the system is missing, raising concerns about resident safety and compliance with the National Building Code.

news.title: Draft Punjab building rules worse than land pooling: PAC
news.para: Ludhiana residents are protesting the Draft Punjab Unified Building Rules 2025, fearing increased traffic and overcrowding. A public action committee argues the rules prioritize developers' profits over citizen well-being. They demand an extension for submitting objections, citing concerns about unlimited floor area ratio (FAR), increased densities, and inadequate fire safety measures.

news.title: Consumer forum orders DLF to compensate buyer for delay in handover of flat in Kakkanad
news.para: The Ernakulam district consumer commission has directed DLF to compensate a customer for a nearly four-year delay in handing over a flat in Kakkanad. The developer was also found guilty of charging additional fees and providing substandard quality. DLF must pay interest on the flat's price, refund rent expenses, and provide compensation for distress and court costs.

news.title: Madhya Pradesh HC summons Bhopal collector in contempt case
news.para: The MP High Court has summoned Bhopal collector Kaushlendra Vikram Singh on August 25 due to a contempt petition. This petition was filed because of non-compliance with a court order to execute a revenue recovery certificate (RRC) for Rs 70 lakh from a builder, issued by RERA.

news.title: Brigade Group leases nine-acre land in Chennai's OMR
news.para: Bengaluru's Brigade Group has secured a long-term lease for nine acres in Chennai. The land is located in Perungudi along Old Mahabalipuram Road. This acquisition from YMCA allows Brigade to develop 1.6 million sq ft. Plans include a Grade-A office complex and a 200-key JW Marriott hotel. This move significantly expands Brigade's commercial and hospitality presence in Chennai.

news.title: Microchip picks up office space in Bengaluru for ₹176 crore
news.para: Microchip Technology, through its Indian arm, has acquired 1.72 lakh sq ft of office space in Whitefield, Bengaluru, for ₹176 crore. The purchase from Ascendum Solution India includes two commercial blocks in the EPIP Zone. This significant transaction, valued at ₹10,230 per sq ft, marks one of the largest office space buyouts in the city this quarter.

news.title: Fit-outs now key revenue engine for flexible offices
news.para: Flexible workspace operators are increasingly benefiting from office fit-outs, which have become a significant revenue stream. India's cost-effective fit-out market, coupled with rising demand for customized workspaces, attracts businesses. Companies like Awfis and Carbon Guardians are expanding their fit-out services, driven by growth in gross leasing and the expansion of global capability centers, contributing significantly to their revenues.
